<table border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td align="center"> <p> This chapter illustrates example scenes for generating and acoustically propagating audio as spatial sound. </p> <p> These examples are based on initial implementation efforts at <a href="https://medialab.hmu.gr/minipages/x3domAudio" target="_blank">Spatial Sound in X3DOM with Web Audio API</a>, extracting and validating the X3D models which are contained in those HTML pages. They implement the Working Draft <a href="https://www.web3d.org/specifications/X3Dv4Draft/ISO-IEC19775-1v4-WD3/Part01/components/sound.html" target="_blank">X3D4 Sound Component</a>. </p> <p> Of additional interest are corresponding <a href="https://web3d.siggraph.org/extending-x3d-realism-audio-graphs-acoustic-properties-3d-spatial-sound" target="_blank">paper</a> and <a href="https://web3d.siggraph.org/x3d-audio-graphs-acoustic-properties-3d-spatial-sound/" target="_blank">tutorial</a> given at the twenty-fifth anniversary <a href="https://web3d.siggraph.org" target="_blank">Web3D 2020 Conference</a>. </p> </td> <td align="left" width="100"> <a href="index.html"><img border="1" alt="Sound Propagation Phenomena" title="Sound Propagation Phenomena" hspace="10" src="SoundPropagationPhenomena.png" width="150" height="91" align="middle"/></a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
